snippet: Ricardo Jaime was convicted after he acknowledged having accepted vacations and free rent from businessmen whose companies had government contracts.
abstract: Argentine judge convicts former transportation minister Ricardo Jaime on corruption charges, punishing him with one and half year suspended sentence and ordering him to pay over $200,000; Jaime admitted he accepted gratuities, including Brazilian vacations and rent-free apartments, from entrepreneurs with government contracts.
lead_paragraph: Ricardo Jaime was convicted after he acknowledged having accepted vacations and free rent from businessmen whose companies had government contracts.

headline.main: Argentina: Former Transportation Official Found Guilty in Graft Case
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Argentina: Former Official Found Guilty in Graft Case
